meanings.definition: To cover or saturate with turpentine.
meanings.sent1: She turpentined the wooden furniture to give it a shiny finish.
meanings.sent2: The artist turpentined the canvas before starting the painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat turpentined the floor, leaving sticky paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The smell of turpentine turpentined the entire room, overpowering all other scents.
meanings.sent5: He turpentined the old fence, bringing out its natural colors and grain.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic turpentined the engine to clean off the grease.
meanings.sent2: She turpentined the wound to prevent infection.
meanings.sent3: The chef turpentined the cutting board to remove any lingering odors.
meanings.sent4: The teacher turpentined the whiteboard, erasing all the old markings.
meanings.sent5: He turpentined the tools, ensuring they were well maintained and rust-free.

meanings.sent1: He carefully turpentined the paintbrush before starting the artwork.
meanings.sent2: She turpentined the cloth to remove the stubborn stain.
meanings.sent3: The gardener turpentined the plant leaves to keep pests away.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter turpentined the wood before varnishing it.
meanings.sent5: The cleaner turpentined the floor, leaving it spotless and gleaming.
